title: [Champion Rework] Lee Sin, The Blind Monk

body:
So, these are probably just some stupid ideas and I just decided to work on a Lee Sin rework since so many complain about how overpowered our Blind Monk is. **Before you read further, just know that I don't typically have bad games against Lee Sin(in fact I think Lee is pretty cool and fun to play as he is), and that I just wanted to do this for fun. **Without further ado:


**[New]** Passive)
Inner Focus/Flurry: Due to his blindness, Lee Sin' s other senses are heightened ten-fold to better compensate for his lack of sight. Since he is blind but has enhanced hearing, smell, and taste(though the last two aren't very important), Lee Sin passively gains Tremor Sense. 

**Tremor Sense**: Enemy champions and neutral monsters within 1350-units that move within the Fog of War have their position revealed for Lee Sin and his allies. This does not grant sight(vision), but Lee can basic attack enemies within melee range and see their silhouettes. 

Additionally, when Lee Sin has Vision of an enemy, his next 2 basic attacks on said enemy have 45% increased attack speed with the first of which ignoring 5% armor and each hit returns 15 furry.
--------------------------
**[New]** Q= Sonic Wave/Unwavering Resolve
Cost for Sonic Wave: 50 energy
Cost for Unwavering Resolve: 20 energy.
Range on Sonic Wave: 1150
Range on Unwavering Resolve: Melee/Lee Sin

Sonic Wave)
Lee Sin shoots a 2000-speed wave of sound in a line, dealing 40/60/90/130/160(+80% Bonus AD) physical damage to the first enemy it hits and granting true sight of it for 3 seconds. If Resonating Strike hits, Lee Sin can cast Unwavering Resolve.

Unwavering Resolve)
Now that Lee Sin has sight of his enemy, he strengthens his resolve against the enemy, dealing true damage with every basic attack towards that enemy while vision is active on them and increasing his own movement speed by 3/6/9/12/15%.

Cooldown: 10/9/8/7/6 seconds.
---------------------------

**[New]** W=Safeguard/Iron Will
Cost on Safeguard: 50 energy
Cost on Iron Will: 30 energy
Range on Safeguard: 500/525/550/575/600 unit radius.
Range on Iron Will: Lee Sin

Safeguard)
Lee Sin dashes to a target ally. If this ally is a champion, they and Lee Sin receive a shield worth 0/80/120/160/200(+90% AP) that lasts 1.75/2/2.25/2.5/2.75 seconds. Lee Sin can activate Safeguard on himself to receive the shield, and can cast Iron Will within 3 seconds.

Iron Will)
For 4 seconds, Lee Sin gains 5/10/15/20/25% bonus life steal and spell vamp.

Cooldown: 14 seconds
-----------------------------------------

**[New]** E=Tempest/Cripple
Cost for Tempest: 50 energy
Cost for Cripple: 30 energy
Range for Tempest: 425 unit radius
Range for Cripple:575 unit radius

Tempest)
Lee Sin smashes the ground, dealing 50 /85/130/165/180(+90% Bonus AD)(+5% AP) magic damage to all nearby enemies and granting true sight of them for 4 seconds. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast Cripple within the next 3 seconds.

Cripple)
Lee Sin cripples all enemies within range that are marked by Tempest, reducing their movement speed by 30/35/40/50/60% for 4 seconds, decaying over the duration. Additionally, crippling an enemy will add 1/1.5/2 second(s) to any currently lasting Vision effects.

Cooldown: 10 seconds. 
-----------------------------------------

Ultimate.
**[New]** R= Dragon's Rage
Range: 400 unit radius

Lee Sin launches a powerful roundhouse kick, dealing 250/450/650(+220% Bonus AD) physical damage to a target champion and knocking it back 1200 units over 1 second. Enemies the target collides with take the same damage and are knocked airborne for 1 second. 

**Here's the kicker(see what I did there?), however: Lee Sin can only use Dragon's Rage on enemies he has Vision of.**

Cool down: 110/95/80 seconds.
-------------------

That's just my small little rework. I'm always open to comments, concerns, and suggestions so feel free to post them below!

replies.body: No. With zero gap closers he will be useless. 0 shield with rank one safeguard? 15% movement speed at max rank q, 5% ap scaling e, 5% armor reduction passive, you have no idea how to balance. This is just made to make Lee Sin useless after having bad games against him.

> [{quoted}](name=Thezanman,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=YEFH2AOp,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-05-06T04:35:16.283+0000)

Any ideas how I can improve the rework then? He isn't going to be getting his gap closers back, unfortunately, but I can always up the movement speed so he can at least catch his enemy.

Also, you are right, I have no idea how to balance. Which is why I wanted to try it.

Im just glad you aren't in charge of balance at Riot. These changes gut Lee as a character. His entire design is about being highly mobile and early game pressure, which he trades for being a late game knock up bot. You remove his mobility(the thing that makes Lee Sin Lee Sin) and decide that giving him Rek'Sai's passive changes that. While it is a very interesting idea i think that changing his identity as a champion is not the way to go.

Also, what do you think about what I did to the ultimate? Good or no?

I think it's an interesting concept. I need to take a closer look at the numbers to determine if it is worth the change or not. It doesn't really change his gameplay. I just think it's a little unnecessary. It feels like you're trying to find things to change to make the rework unique. Common with fan reworks or designs, it doesn't really do anything but change his skill order(might not even do that depending on how you play him). If it buffs the damage on his ult then i can see it working. But if it keeps it the same or lowers it then this is very bad idea. I appreciate the effort put in to your rework but i think it's unnecessary. Lee isn't that good right now anyway {{item:3070}} {{champion:64}} {{item:3070}}

Good luck getting your rework accepted without giving him gapclosers. If you really want to make him weaker, just get rid of all this nonsense and nerf the speed or projectile width of his q or something, firing a sonic wave to detect an enemy and then just moving slightly faster towards them doesn't make any sense. I would say to remove the wardhopping, but that's an iconic part of his kit, all Lee Sin players would rage if that was removed. He's strong, but only really in a 1v1. If you just fight him in a group and don't line up to get kicked into eachother, you can fight him easily.

I actually love this rework! Im not even a Lee Sin player but I gotta admit the idea's you have are great. In my personal opinion I only see two flaws.
1. I dont think Tremor Sense should apply to teamates, or I dont think you shoud only see their silhouettes even in melee range. Keep in mind that "Your the summoner" not actually Lee Sin.
2. I still think you should keep the ward hopping, only because pro players utilize this mechanic in high competitive play and it could cause alot of conflict.

But If I had to choose, I would say the best part of this rework is the new Dragon's Rage... I like how you made is 20% stronger but only on targets with vision!

Also, if your into Champion Concepts, could you take a look at a creation I made [Here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/cTaEMn52-champion-concept-sanders-the-bloodstoned-commander) And if possible give me a review. Thanks, and I hope my thoughts help with this post
